items.name: Jameson, Ginger Ale & Lime Recipe
items.ingredients: 30ml Jameson Original, 90ml Ginger Ale, 1 Wedge Lime
items.preparation: Fill a high ball glass with ice and pour in a short of Jameson. Top up the glass with a good quality ginger ale and stir briefly to mix. Take a large wedge of lime, give it a squeeze and drop it into the glass. Roughly 1 part Jameson to 3 parts ginger ale, all parts refreshing.
items.description: How to make the perfect Whiskey & Ginger Ale – Jameson Whiskey, ginger ale, and a squeeze of lime – your go-to whiskey refresher.

items.name: Jameson Buck
items.ingredients: 35ml Jameson Original, 10ml Lime Juice, Ginger Beer - Top, 1 Lime Wedge
items.preparation: Fill highball with ice. Add Jameson and lime juice, then fill to top with ginger beer. Insert garnish and serve with a smile.
items.description: Trends are made to be bucked! We love a JGL (who doesn’t?) but variety is the spice of life. That’s what the Jameson Buck is all about. All the flavours of a Jameson Ginger and Lime, with a spicy kick!

items.name: Jameson Irish Coffee Recipe
items.ingredients: 30ml Cream, 10ml Demerara Sugar Syrup, 90ml Espresso, 35ml Jameson Original, Grated Nutmeg, 1 Vanilla Pod.
items.preparation: Dissolve 2 parts Demerara sugar in 3 parts of boiling water for the syrup. Stir sugar syrup into 35ml Jameson in a warmed glass. Whip 30ml chilled double cream lightly until it starts to stiffen. Brew a 45ml shot of coffee into the glass from your espresso machine. Pour the whipped cream into the coffee over the back a spoon so it floats on top. Garnish with a trimmed vanilla pod or a stick of cinnamon and dust with a grating of fresh nutmeg.
items.description: When it comes to coffee drinks, there’s nothing more quintessentially Irish than adding in a little drop of Jameson Irish Whiskey to make a cold winter evening more enjoyable.

items.name: The Bow St. Collins
items.ingredients: 15ml Elderflower Liqueur, Ice Cube, 30ml Jameson Original, 1 Twist Lemon, 30 ml Lemon Juice, 10ml Lillet Blanc, 90ml Soda Water.
items.preparation: Combine your Jameson Original, Fillet Blanc, elderflower liqueur and lemon juice together and stir. Pour into a highball glass filled with cubed ice and stir once more, before topping up with soda and water. Garnish with a lemon twist.
items.description: Put a spin on your old Collins friend with this Jameson Original recipe, set off with Lillet Blanc and Elderflower. This long drink is a Dublin refresher, perfect for summer days and cooler nights alike.

items.name: Strawberry Fields
items.ingredients: 50ml Jameson Original, 100ml Strawberry Fields Batch, 100ml Dry Vermouth, 100ml Italian Bitter, 150 ml Strawberry Cordial, 150ml Lemon Juice, 500ml Cloudy Apple Juice, 1 Mint Sprig.
items.preparation: Shake batch bottle vigorously. Fill tumbler with ice. Add ingredients. Hand clap mint sprig, insert with slice of strawberry and enjoy.
items.description: Life is all about less stress, more success with this prebatched Summer serve. As this baby is all about speed. Saving you time. Meaning more time for creating newfound connections with those that matter.

items.name: Jameson Ginger Ice Pops
items.image: Jameson ginger and lime ice pops
items.ingredients: 30ml Jameson Original, 120ml Ginger Ale, 1 Squeeze Fresh Lime.
items.preparation: Batch and pour popsicle cold. Freeze overnight.
items.description: Summer is about to POP off, and our Jameson Ginger & Lime Ice Pops are the whiskey treat you’ve been missing. Jameson on the rocks? Hello, old friend. Jameson on a stick? Ice to meet ya!

items.name: Classic Jameson Whiskey Sour
items.ingredients: 30ml Jameson Black Barrel, 3 Dashes Angostura Bitters, 1 Egg White, Ml Ice Cube, 1 Spiral Lemon, 25ml Lemon Juice, 15ml Simple Syrup.
items.preparation: Fill a shaker with ice, and then add your Jameson Black Barrel, freshly-squeezed lemon juice, sugar syrup, egg white and 3 dashes of Angostura bitters. Shake and strain a chilled rocks glass, before garnishing with a lemon twist.
items.description: Sweet, sour and everything delicious. The whiskey sour is one of the best all-time classic cocktails. If you’re looking to impress your friends with a flavoursome cocktail, learn how to make a whiskey sour, it’s a sure-fire way to keep them sweet (not sour!).

items.name: NDU by Kamsi Brown
items.ingredients: 60ml Jameson Black Barrel, 15ml Drilled Vanilla Liqueur, 50ml Fresh Squeezed Pineapple Juice, 10ml Simple Syrup, 25ml Fresh Lemon Juice, 3 Ruby Grapes, 1 Bar Spoon Honey, 1 Tiny Piece Fresh Ginger Fruits, 3 Pieces Basil Leaves.
items.preparation: Add the 3 Ruby grapes and 1 part tiny fresh ginger into a Boston shaker muddle all together.
items.description: Pairing with Jameson for International Women’s Day 2023, Kasmi looked to Mother Earth for inspiration for her cocktail and so the NDU was cultivated. What a beautiful tribute to the woman that gives us all life. A floral cocktail, picked from nature. “ I call this cocktail “NDU” Which means “LIFE” in the Nigerian “IGBO” dialects. My carefully selected NDU recipes accentuates perfectly well with the flavour profile of the Jameson Black Barrel Whiskey. Bringing balance to the fruity, nutty and vanilla notes found in the Jameson black barrel taste.”

items.name: Maple Old Fashioned
items.ingredients: 50ml Jameson Black Barrel, 10ml Maple Syrup, 1 Dash of Angostura Bitter, 2 Dashes of Chocolate Bitter.
items.preparation: Add all ingredients into stirring glass and add ice. Stir for 10-12 seconds. Strain into tumbler with ice. Garnish, serve and enjoy.
items.description: Sweet delicous nectar of the Gods… literally. That’s what this duo envoke when paired as one. Old friends who when together, make something more.

items.name: Black Barrel High Ball
items.ingredients: 35ml Jameson Black Barrel, 2 Dashes of Orange Bitter, Soda - Top.
items.preparation: Fill highball glass with ice. Express orange zest over the drink, insert and enjoy.
items.description: This Japanese favourite is a legendary serve. A staple in Tokyo and beyond. Now making it’s way across th globe and ballin it’s way through the USA.

items.name: Crimson Cranberry Punch
items.ingredients: 45ml Jameson Black Barrel, 1 Dash of Angostura Bitters Per Serve, 30ml Cranberry Juice, 15ml Cinnamon Syrup, 15ml Lemon Juice, 15ml Club Soda.
items.preparation: Build all ingredients together in a punch bowl Garnish with lemon wheels, orange wheels, cranberries Serve in rocks glasses chilled over ice.
items.description: This bright coloured crowd-pleaser is sure to make any holiday get together even better.

items.name: Fancy Free
items.ingredients: 60ml Jameson Black Barrel, 2 Dash Angostura Bitters, 15ml Maraschino Liqueur, 45ml water.
items.preparation: Glass: Rocks Batch. Pour over large cube Garnish with cherries and lemon twist.
items.description: Ok, it may not be free as such. But it sure is a little fancy to be fair.

items.name: The HomeMATE
items.ingredients: 15ml Amaro, 1 Dash Angostura Bitter, 5ml Honey Syrup, Ice Cubes, 50ml Jameson IPA Edition, 1 Sprig Rosemary.
items.preparation: Make Honey Syrup: Add 250ml boiling water to 500g of honey and stir well, bottle and refrigerate. Stir all ingredients with ice in a mixing glass or one tin from your cocktail shaker until chilled. Strain over fresh ice or a single large ice cube in a rocks glass. Garnish with a rosemary sprig.

items.name: Mr.Earl
items.ingredients: 15ml Earl Grey Tea Syrup, Ice Cubes, 50ml Jameson IPA Edition, 25ml Lemon Juice, 1 Tablespoon Marmalade, 1 Dash Orange Bitter, Orange Zest.
items.preparation: To make Earl Grey tea syrup: Add two earl grey tea bags to 250ml just boiled water and allow to steep for 5 minutes. Remove tea bags and add 250g of white sugar. Heat gently in a saucepan, stirring well until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat, allow to cool and refrigerate. Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake vigorously until chilled. Double strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with an orange zest.

items.name: The Ginger Brew
items.ingredients: 50ml Jameson IPA Edition, 30ml Honey Syrup, Lime Juice, 70 your Favourite IPA, 15ml, 1ml Rosemary.
items.preparation: Honey Syrup: Add 250ml boiling water to 500ml honey and stir well. Allow to cool, bottle and refrigerate. Muddle 3 ginger chunks in the base of a cocktail shaker before adding 50ml Jameson IPA Edition, 30ml honey syrup, 15ml lemon and 15ml lime juice. Shake well before straining into a highball glass filled with cubed ice. Top up with 70ml IPA and garnish with a twist of lemon peel and a sprig of fresh rosemary.

items.name: IPA Shandy
items.ingredients: 1 Wedge Grapefruit, Ice Cube, 30ml IPA Beer, 45ml Jameson IPA Edition, 90ml Lemonade, 15ml Lemon Juice.
items.preparation: Add all ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice and stir gentle. Garnish with a grapefruit wedge.

items.name: Hop-To-It
items.ingredients: 1 Wedge Grapefruit, Ice Cube, 30ml IPA Beer, 45ml Jameson IPA Edition, 90ml Lemonade, 15ml Lemon Juice.
items.preparation: Mix one part Jameson IPA Edition, two parts pale ale and two parts lemonade. Serve over ice in a highball glass, with a lemon wedge garnish.

items.name: Tropical IPA
items.ingredients: 1 Wheel Coconut Flakes, 75ml Coconut Water, Ice Cubes, 10ml IPA Syrup, 35ml Jameson IPA Edition, 10ml Lime Juice, 1 Wheel Sea Salt Flakes.
items.preparation: Make an IPA Syrup: In medium saucepan over medium heat, stir together the IPA with 1 cup go sugar and water until the sugar dissolves. Increase heat slightly, then simmer 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Refrigerate syrup until cold, about 2 hours. Make the tropical IPA. Stir the Jameson IPA Edition with coconut water, IPA syrup and fresh lime juice in a mixing glass filled with rock ice. Rim your highball with the Sea Salt Flakes & some dry coconut. Strain your preparation into the ice filled highball.

items.name: The Balsa Wood
items.ingredients: 10ml Balsamic Syrup, Ice Cube, 60ml Jameson Stout Edition, 2 Dashes Orange Bitters, Orange Zest.
items.preparation: Add all ingredients to a rocks glass filled with ice and stir to chill. Express the oils from the orange zest and garnish the cocktail with the zest. To make a balsamic reduction: add 250ml balsamic vinegar and 250g Demerara sugar to a saucepan. Simmer for 5 minutes on a medium heat. Allow to cool, bottle and refrigerate.

items.name: Jameson Stout Edition & Soda
items.ingredients: Ice Cubes, 50ml Jameson Stout Edition, Orange, 90ml Soda Water.
items.preparation: Add your Jameson Stout Edition and good quality soda water to a highball glass with ice and stir gently. Garnish with an orange slice.

items.name: Bitter Sweet
items.ingredients: 20ml Campari, 1 Wedge Grapefruit, Ice Cube, 40ml Jameson Stout Edition, 20ml Pink Grapefruit Juice.
items.preparation: Build in a highball over ice and stir gently.

items.name: Orange You Glad You Came?
items.ingredients: Ice Cubes, 35ml Jameson Stout Edition, 20ml Lemon Juice, 30ml Orange Cordial, Rosemary, 100ml Soda Water.
items.preparation: Build over ice in a highball glass. Garnish with an orange zest or a sprig of rosemary. To make Orange Cordial: 6 oranges (Or 500ml OJ from a carton), 200g sugar. Add the juice of the oranges, the zest of half an oranges and sugar to a saucepan and heat on a medium low heat to dissolve the sugar.(You can keep the rest of the orange skins for garnishes if you like.) Once sugar is dissolve, allow to cool before straining out the orange zest. Bottle and refrigerate.

items.name: The Grand Stretch
items.ingredients: Ice Cubes, 15ml Iced Coffee, 50ml Jameson Stout Edition, 30ml Kahlua, 30ml Milk.
items.preparation: Add all ingredients to a rocks glass filled with ice and stir gently.

items.name: Twist and Shout
items.ingredients: 20 ml Creme De Banane, 1 Wedge Grapefruit, Ice Cubes, 80ml IPA Beer, 40ml Jameson Stout Edition.
items.preparation: Build in a highball over ice and stir gently. Squeeze a wedge of pink grapefruit.

items.name: Jameson Cold Brew & Cream Soda
items.ingredients: 30ml Jameson Cold Brew. 60ml Cream Soda.
items.preparation: Build over ice.

items.name: Jameson Cold Brew Iced Latte
items.ingredients: 45ml Jameson Cold Brew. 90ml Cold Brew Coffee. 30ml Heavy Whipped Cream. Whipped Cream.
items.preparation: Build over ice in a collins glass. Stir gently once or twice to blend. Gently pour the cream over the top to create a layer.

items.name: Jameson Cold Brew Hot Chocolate
items.ingredients: 60ml Jameson Cold Brew. 150ml Hot Chocolate. Garnish(Optional): mini marshmallows, chocolate squares, and crushed graham cracker rim. Mini Marshmallows.
items.preparation: Build hot chocolate in a small pan, according to packet instruction. Add Jameson Cold Brew. Whisk. Heat to simmer. Dip rim into hot chocolate mixture and then crush graham cracker. Pour cocktail into a mug or mason jar. Top with mini marshmallows and chocolate squares.

items.name: Dalton Iced Coffee
items.ingredients: 1 Pinch Cinnamon. 60ml Espresso Coffee(cold). 60ml Hot Water. Ice Cubes. 30ml Jameson Cold Brew. 90ml Milk. 60ml Sugar.
items.preparation: In mixing bowl add instant coffee, sugar and hot water. Whisk until light and fluffy. In a glass, fill 3/4 of the way with 3 parts milk of choice and part Jameson Cold Brew. Add coffee fluff to top and garnish with cinnamon.

items.name: Jameson Cold Brew Cooler
items.ingredients: 75ml Cold Brew Coffee. 10ml Fresh Homemade Vanilla Cordial. Ice Cubes. 30ml Jameson Cold Brew.
items.preparation: MAKE VANILLA SYRUP: In medium saucepan over medium heat, stir together 1 cup sugar, 2 tbs pure vanilla extracts and 2 cups water until sugar dissolves. Increase heat slightly, then simmer 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Refrigerate syrup until cold, about 2 hours. MAKE THE JAMESON COLD BREW COOLER: Pour all the ingredients into a shaker half-filled with ice and shake. Serve in an ice filled highball

items.name: Jameson Cold Brew Cold Irish Coffee
items.image: Jameson cold brew cold irish coffee
items.ingredients: 40ml Cold Brew Coffee. 10ml Demerara Sugar Syrup. Ice Cubes. 50ml Jameson Cold Brew.
items.preparation: Pour Jameson Cold Brew, cold brew coffee and Demorara sugar syrup into a mixing glass with ice and stir for 15-25 seconds. Pour fresh cream into shaker. Shake without ice to thicken the cream for 15-25 seconds. Fill glass with ice, almost to the top, you don’t want it to poke through the cream head. Pour stirred liquid into glass. Top up the glass by gently pouring your cream onto the top using your bar spoon to make sure the cream doesn’t sink.

items.name: Jameson Cold Brew & Cream Soda
items.ingredients: 30ml Jameson Cold Brew. 60ml Cream Soda.
items.preparation: Build over ice.

items.name: Heavenly Highball
items.ingredients: 45ml Jameson Orange. 30ml Oloroso Sherry. Dash Orange Bitters. 90ml Soda.
items.preparation: In a highball glass, build ingredients. Garnish with an orange twist and mint sprig.

items.name: Orangerie(A Boulevardier Blanc)
items.ingredients: 45ml Jameson Orange. 30ml Millet Blanc. 15ml Italicus.
items.preparation: Dash Orange bitters. Glass: Rocks or Up. Stir ingredients. Garnish with an orange twist.

items.name: Bow St. Smash
items.ingredients: 45ml Jameson Orange. 4 Lemon Wedges. Mint Leaves. 15ml Vanilla/Simple Syrup.
items.preparation: Grab a rocks glass. Muddle lemon, mint and syrup. Shake and strain. Garnish with orange twist and mint leaves.

items.name: Jameson Irish Cosmo
items.ingredients: 45ml Jameson Orange. 7.5ml Lime Juice. 15ml Triple Sec. 15ml Cranberry Juice.
items.preparation: Mix all ingredients in cocktail shaker. Strain into couple glass. Garnish with orange twist.

items.name: Jameson Orange Burst Cocktail Recipe
items.ingredients: 45ml Jameson Orange. 30ml Triple Sec. 90ml Orange Juice. 30ml Lemon-Lime Soda.
items.preparation: Grab a pint. Build ingredients over ice. Garnish with an orange half moon.

items.name: Crested X Eight Degrees Neat
items.ingredients: 35ml Jameson Crested x Eight Degrees.
items.preparation: Serve in your favourite whiskey glass. Relax and enjoy.

items.name: Jameson Crested Neat
items.ingredients: 35ml Jameson Crested.
items.preparation: Serve in your favourite tumbler glass. Enjoy!

items.name: Talk of the Town
items.ingredients: 10ml Amaro Montehegro. 3 Dashes Chocolate Bitter. 5ml Cinnamon Syrup. Ice Cubes. 40ml Jameson Crested x Eight Degrees Brewing, 25ml Lillet Rouge, 1 Peel Orange, 2 Dashes Orange Bitters.
items.preparation: Fill a mixing glass with ice. Pour all ingredients over ice and stir well. Strain and pour into a coupe glass. Garnish with orange peel.

items.name: Bow St. Lemonade
items.ingredients: 40ml Jameson Crested. 15ml Rhubarb Liqueur. 80ml Lemoade. 5ml Honey Syrup. 25ml Lemon(fresh). 1 Sprig Mind Leaf. Ice Cubes.
items.preparation: Give all ingredients except the cloudy lemonade a quick shake with ice and strain into a highball glass filled with ice. Top with lemonade and garnish with a mint sprig.

items.name: An Chead Cheim(The First Step)
items.ingredients: 150ml Apple Juice, fresh pressed. 3 Dashes Cardamon Bitter. 35ml Jameson Crested X Devi's Ladder. Ice Cubes.
items.preparation: Fill highball glass with ice. Pour whiskey. Add your apple juice. Add 3 dashes of bitters. Quick stir. Garnish with apple fan or wedge, serve.​

items.name: Berry Berry High
items.ingredients: 50ml Jameson Crested X Devi's Ladder. 35ml Fresh Homemade Raspberry Cordial. Ice Cubes. 20ml Lemon Juice. 35ml Soda Water.
items.preparation: Make the berry cordial – go onnnn! Add 500g of mixed berries, 500g of sugar and 3 teaspoons of redwine vinegar to a pot. Mash over a low heat for 10 minutes until smooth and syrupy; Rub through a sieve into a clean pot. Tip what’s left in the sieve into a bowl, add 300ml of water and stir. Sieve again to remove the last of the pulp from any seeds. Pour this liquid into the pot with the syrup you originally strained. Add vanilla and cloves, stir well and bring to boil for 1 min then slowly simmer for another 5 minutes. Pour into sterilised bottle.​ Unopened bottles will have a few months shelf life, when opened keep in fridge​. Fill highball or collins glass with ice. Add Whiskey, Cordial and Lemon juice. Stir to blend, then add more ice and top with soda water, again giving a slight stir to ensure drink is nicely mixed. Garnish with lemon oil and peel, then add a mixed berry skewer.​

items.name: Crested X Eight Degrees Neat
items.ingredients: 35ml Jameson Crested x Eight Degrees.
items.preparation: Serve in your favourite whiskey glass. Relax and enjoy.

items.name: Jameson Crested Neat
items.ingredients: 35ml Jameson Crested.
items.preparation: Serve in your favourite tumbler glass. Enjoy!

items.name: Talk of the Town
items.ingredients: 10ml Amaro Montehegro. 3 Dashes Chocolate Bitter. 5ml Cinnamon Syrup. Ice Cubes. 40ml Jameson Crested x Eight Degrees Brewing, 25ml Lillet Rouge, 1 Peel Orange, 2 Dashes Orange Bitters.
items.preparation: Fill a mixing glass with ice. Pour all ingredients over ice and stir well. Strain and pour into a coupe glass. Garnish with orange peel.

items.name: Bow St. Lemonade
items.ingredients: 40ml Jameson Crested. 15ml Rhubarb Liqueur. 80ml Lemoade. 5ml Honey Syrup. 25ml Lemon(fresh). 1 Sprig Mind Leaf. Ice Cubes.
items.preparation: Give all ingredients except the cloudy lemonade a quick shake with ice and strain into a highball glass filled with ice. Top with lemonade and garnish with a mint sprig.

items.name: An Chead Cheim(The First Step)
items.ingredients: 150ml Apple Juice, fresh pressed. 3 Dashes Cardamon Bitter. 35ml Jameson Crested X Devi's Ladder. Ice Cubes.
items.preparation: Fill highball glass with ice. Pour whiskey. Add your apple juice. Add 3 dashes of bitters. Quick stir. Garnish with apple fan or wedge, serve.​

items.name: Berry Berry High
items.ingredients: 50ml Jameson Crested X Devi's Ladder. 35ml Fresh Homemade Raspberry Cordial. Ice Cubes. 20ml Lemon Juice. 35ml Soda Water.
items.preparation: Make the berry cordial – go onnnn! Add 500g of mixed berries, 500g of sugar and 3 teaspoons of redwine vinegar to a pot. Mash over a low heat for 10 minutes until smooth and syrupy; Rub through a sieve into a clean pot. Tip what’s left in the sieve into a bowl, add 300ml of water and stir. Sieve again to remove the last of the pulp from any seeds. Pour this liquid into the pot with the syrup you originally strained. Add vanilla and cloves, stir well and bring to boil for 1 min then slowly simmer for another 5 minutes. Pour into sterilised bottle.​ Unopened bottles will have a few months shelf life, when opened keep in fridge​. Fill highball or collins glass with ice. Add Whiskey, Cordial and Lemon juice. Stir to blend, then add more ice and top with soda water, again giving a slight stir to ensure drink is nicely mixed. Garnish with lemon oil and peel, then add a mixed berry skewer.​

items.name: Crested X Eight Degrees Neat
items.ingredients: 35ml Jameson Crested x Eight Degrees.
items.preparation: Serve in your favourite whiskey glass. Relax and enjoy.
items.description: Enjoy the rich stout influence; malt and vanilla chocolate combining with Jameson Crested pot still spices and dried fruits.

items.name: Talk of the Town
items.ingredients: 10ml Amaro Montehegro. 3 Dashes Chocolate Bitter. 5ml Cinnamon Syrup. Ice Cubes. 40ml Jameson Crested x Eight Degrees Brewing, 25ml Lillet Rouge, 1 Peel Orange, 2 Dashes Orange Bitters.
items.preparation: Fill a mixing glass with ice. Pour all ingredients over ice and stir well. Strain and pour into a coupe glass. Garnish with orange peel.
items.description: Be the ‘Talk of the Town’ with this sweet, spicy delight. Made from Jameson Crested x Eight Degrees.

items.name: Eight Degrees Stout and Spiced
items.ingredients: 3 Dashes Chocolate Bitter. 100ml Fever Tree Spiced Orange Ginger Ale. Ice Cubes. 40ml Jameson Crested x Eight Degrees Brewing.
items.preparation: Fill a highball glass with ice. Pour in whiskey, bitters and top with spiced ginger ale. Garnish with an orange wedge.​
items.description: A surprisingly refreshing malty long-drink, equally suited to warm summer days or cosy evenings by the fire.

items.name: An Chead Cheim(The First Step)
items.ingredients: 150ml Apple Juice, fresh pressed. 3 Dashes Cardamon Bitter. 35ml Jameson Crested X Devi's Ladder. Ice Cubes.
items.preparation: Fill highball glass with ice. Pour whiskey. Add your apple juice. Add 3 dashes of bitters. Quick stir. Garnish with apple fan or wedge, serve.​
items.description: Easily made and the perfect refreshing drink for when those warm Irish days hit. Highlighting the subtle green apple notes of the whiskey and complimenting the spice notes of the infusion.

items.name: Berry Berry High
items.ingredients: 50ml Jameson Crested X Devi's Ladder. 35ml Fresh Homemade Raspberry Cordial. Ice Cubes. 20ml Lemon Juice. 35ml Soda Water.
items.preparation: Make the berry cordial – go onnnn! Add 500g of mixed berries, 500g of sugar and 3 teaspoons of redwine vinegar to a pot. Mash over a low heat for 10 minutes until smooth and syrupy; Rub through a sieve into a clean pot. Tip what’s left in the sieve into a bowl, add 300ml of water and stir. Sieve again to remove the last of the pulp from any seeds. Pour this liquid into the pot with the syrup you originally strained. Add vanilla and cloves, stir well and bring to boil for 1 min then slowly simmer for another 5 minutes. Pour into sterilised bottle.​ Unopened bottles will have a few months shelf life, when opened keep in fridge​. Fill highball or collins glass with ice. Add Whiskey, Cordial and Lemon juice. Stir to blend, then add more ice and top with soda water, again giving a slight stir to ensure drink is nicely mixed. Garnish with lemon oil and peel, then add a mixed berry skewer.​
items.description: Very very high(ball)… Get it?! This recipe is a great one to try for expanding your home-bartender skills. Cordials are simple to make and have a long shelf-life, giving you something new to brag about on your next zoom call (Take that sour-dough starter ;) It’s also a great drink to make in a pitcher to serve up at a garden party or barbeque.

items.name: Verti-go on Ya Good Thing
items.ingredients: 1 Dash Angostura Bitter. 1 Whole Cinnamon Cane. 1ml Cinnamon Syrup. 50ml Jameson Crested x Devi's Ladder. Ice Cubes. 3 Dashes Jameson Seaweed Bitter.
items.preparation: To make cinnamon and clove infused syrup: Add two parts sugar or honey to one part water to pot and bring to boil. Immediately lower to simmer. Add crushed sticks and cloves. Stir until dissolved and leave simmering for 10-15 mins. Strain cinnamon and cloves, let cool and ready to use. Tip: if you leave the cinnamon and cloves in the syrup while storing it, it will develop more intense flavour.​ To make the cocktail: Fill Glass with large cubes to chill. Using a mixing jug add your four ingredients. Add ice, stir for dilution. Id recommend 10-12 seconds, or stir until your preferred taste. Strain any excess water from ice and pour drink over ice. Garnish with orange peel oil (discard peel after use) and hold a flame to a cinnamon stick until it chars and smokes, add cinnamon stick to glass​.​
items.description: The Verti-go on ya good thing will have you facing your fears. This is a whiskey forward drink to capture the caramel and spicy notes, which both the whiskey and Ale are known for.

items.name: Jameson Triple Triple Neat
items.ingredients: 35ml Jameson Triple Triple
items.preparation: Pour and enjoy.​
items.description: Jameson has always brought new friends to the table, so this time our Bourbon and Sherry casks were introduced to hand selected Málaga wines wine casks.

items.name: Jameson Triple Triple on The Rocks
items.image: Jameson triple triple on the rocks
items.ingredients: Ice Cubes. 35ml Jameson Triple Triple.
items.preparation: Pour over tumbler glass with ice.
items.description: A Triple Cask matured Jameson whiskey that includes the addition of Málaga cask.

items.name: Jameson Triple Triple with Toic & Grapefruit
items.image: Jameson triple triple with tonic & grapefruit
items.ingredients: 1 Quarter Grapefruit. Ice Cubes. 35ml Jameson Triple Triple. 100ml Tonic Water.
items.preparation: Build in Highball glass. Squeeze in the 1/4 grapefruit. Garnish with one grapefruit wedge.​
items.description: Grapefruit works great with the slightly dryer notes of Jameson Triple Triple, while the Tonic will give it a bit of effervescence.
